intro: Ornithogalum natalense, commonly known as Natal star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Its flowers are arranged in a cluster at the top of a leafless stem, creating a dramatic visual effect. Natal star-of-Bethlehem is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
